com.soa.message.script
Class Headers

java.lang.Object
  com.soa.message.script.Headers

public class Headers
extends java.lang.Object

Holds transport headers for a message. This object is returned from Message.getTransportHeaders() as follows: 

    headers = message.getTransportHeaders();
The headers in this collection are represented by the Header object. The following retrieves a header: 
    header = headers.get("Authentication");

This collection of headers can be changed. It supports the addition, changing, and removing of headers. The following will add or change a header: 

    headers.add("Content-Type", "application/xml");

The following will remove a header: 

    headers.remove("Authentication");

Method Detail

getArray

public Header[] getArray()
Returns the headers as an array of Header. Changes to the returned array are not reflected in this object.

Returns:
Header array.

get

public Header get(java.lang.String name)
Returns the Header object for the given header name, null if no header with the given name is present.

Parameters:
name - Name of the header to return. Name lookup is case-insensitive.
Returns:
Header, or null.

getDate

public Header getDate(java.lang.String name)
Returns the Header object for the given header name as a date, null if no header with the given name is present.

Parameters:
name - Name of the header to return. Name lookup is case-insensitive.
Returns:
Header, or null.

add

public void add(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String value)
         throws com.digev.fw.exception.GException
Adds a header. This will override any existing header with the specified name.

Parameters:
name - The header name. Name lookup is case-insensitive.
value - The header value. This may include any parameters, and may be multi-valued with each value separated by a comma.
Throws:
com.digev.fw.exception.GException - Thrown if the header could not be parsed.

add

public void add(java.lang.String name,
                java.util.Date value)
         throws com.digev.fw.exception.GException
Adds a date header. This will override any existing header with the specified name.

Parameters:
name - The header name. Name lookup is case-insensitive.
value - The header value as a Date.
Throws:
com.digev.fw.exception.GException - Thrown if the header could not be parsed.

remove

public void remove(java.lang.String name)
Removes the headaer with the given name.

Parameters:
name - The header name. Name lookup is case-insensitive.

contains

public boolean contains(java.lang.String name)
Returns whether or not a header with the given name exists.

Parameters:
name - The header name. Name lookup is case-insensitive.
Returns:
true if the header exists, false if not.
